subject: Economics
title: The Economics of Queuing: Why We Hate Waiting
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Economics of Queuing: Why We Hate Waiting.

hook.text: Houston airport had a baggage complaint problem. They sped up bag delivery. Complaints didn't drop.

buildup.text: Passengers now walked 6 minutes to the carousel instead of waiting 6 minutes at it. Same total time.

discovery.text: Occupied time (walking) feels shorter than unoccupied time (standing).

twist.text: Uncertain waits feel longer than known waits.

climax.text: The economics of queuing isn't about reducing wait time â€” it's about reducing the perception of wait time.

punchline.text: The best solution to a waiting problem is making people not realize they're.

quiz.question: How did Houston airport reduce baggage complaints without speeding up delivery?
options: Moved the carousel farther away so passengers walked instead of standing and waiting
